AD_Reunion.synopsis: Wulbren has just been rescued from Moonrise towers and is in last light inn. His back is to Barcus and he's ignoring him. Barcus is frantically trying to his attention.

AD_GnomeAndCat.synopsis: Overhead text of Barcus Wroot casually interacting with His Majesty, the local cat.

Gnome001.synopsis: This gnome was saved from Moonrise Jail by the players.
Gnome001.how_to_trigger: Free from jail in Moonrise, then talk in Haven.

Gnome002.synopsis: This gnome was saved from Moonrise Jail by the players.
Gnome002.how_to_trigger: Free from jail in Moonrise, then talk in Haven.

Wulbren.synopsis: Wulbren is holding counsel with his fellow gnomes (if they survived moonrise) when he is interrupted by the player. He is condescending a arrogant. We can discover a little about the ironhand gnomes.
Wulbren.how_to_trigger: Free from jail in Moonrise, then talk in Haven.

AD_SeekingWulbren.synopsis: Barcus has been told Wulbren is back and is looking for him.

Reunion.synopsis: Barcus runs up to Wulbren in Haven after Wulbren is released from MOO. This is the culmination of everything he's been working for for the whole game and is so excited to see his friend - and find out what the deal wis with the runepowder plot. Barcus is swiftly rebuked by Wulbren and left disappointed but trying to save face.
Reunion.how_to_trigger: - Free gnomes from MOO- Tell Barcus Wulbren is back- Follow and talk to either one of them.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners.synopsis: These ADs occur after the gnomes are rescued by the player from Moonrise jail. They occur in Haven. The gnomes are trying to figure out what to do. Their varations include: Wulbren, Nimble and Nickels alive, Wulbren and Nimble alive, Wulbren and Nickels alive, Nickels and Nimble alive.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners.how_to_trigger: Gnome prisoners from Moonrise are seated at a table in Haven and chat together.

UnfortunateGnome.synopsis: The unfortunate gnome is playing with his powders, his mood downcast and face smeared with soot. He's learnt that the gnomes are at Moonrise. He'll ask us again to help them if we haven't agreed already. He has nodes to cover alternate states in HAV, but not as many as e.g. harpers. He is mostly concerned with Wulbren, and other matters are of little import to him.This dialogue will be expanded when we have clear messaging around what happened to the gnomes in HAV and how Barcus should react to them.
UnfortunateGnome.how_to_trigger: Loadlevel SCL_Main_AOpen debug book > Act 2 Setup > Tiefling PathIn debug book > Go to region > Haven > After Checkpoint > Just gogoto -59, 134Talk to Barcus

AD_Reunion_0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_Reunion_0.text: There must be another way to the city.
AD_Reunion_0.context: NodeContext: talking to himself, trying to figure out a solution

AD_Reunion_4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Reunion_4.text: Perhaps I could be of assistance?

AD_Reunion_8.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_Reunion_8.text: I have little time for eavesdroppers.

AD_Reunion_1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Reunion_1.context: NodeContext: earnest, trying to get his friend's attention

AD_Reunion_3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_Reunion_3.text: Yet I don't recall asking for a stranger's opinion. Be on your way.
AD_Reunion_3.context: NodeContext: doesn't realise who it is, annoyed an dismissive

AD_Reunion_5.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Reunion_5.context: NodeContext: earnest and a little hurt

AD_Reunion_2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_Reunion_2.context: NodeContext: earnest and genuine - trying to get his friend's attention

AD_GnomeAndCat_4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat_4.text: I'll be out of your way as soon as I'm finished...

AD_GnomeAndCat_6.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat_6.text: Hmm... perhaps a bit more of this...

AD_GnomeAndCat_11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat_11.text: Good point. I hadn't thought of that.

AD_GnomeAndCat_7.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat_7.context: NodeContext: Gently to himself, more worried than upset.

AD_GnomeAndCat_1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat_1.text: I'll tell him you said so.

AD_GnomeAndCat_15.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_GnomeAndCat_15.text: I heard you the first time.

Gnome001_0.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_0.text: Aren't you going to take down Ketheric? We'll support you from here.
Gnome001_0.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Gnome001_1.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_1.text: Oh! That'll be all, but thank you!
Gnome001_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

Gnome001_2.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_2.text: I suppose you'll be trotting off soon too. Don't let me stop you.

Gnome001_3.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_3.text: I suppose this place will do for now. Better than a cell in the Towers, at the very least.
Gnome001_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.NodeContext: Arrogance; player has saved him and brought him here.

Gnome001_4.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_4.text: I'd thank you for your help, but I doubt you need to hear such trivialities. So I'll just say fare-thee-well.

Gnome001_5.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_5.text: I say, every last soldier in this place has abandoned us. So much for duty.

Gnome001_6.speaker: Nimble
Gnome001_6.text: Ketheric's forces are infiltrating this place - you've got to take the fight to them!
Gnome001_6.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Gnome002_0.speaker: Nickels
Gnome002_0.text: I don't like the sky, it's too big - too empty. Whatever made that light isn't our friend. No chance.

Gnome002_1.speaker: Nickels
Gnome002_1.text: Good foundations. Hear that? Place was built with love. Symmetry. Glad to be here. Thank you.
Gnome002_1.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Met.

Gnome002_2.speaker: Nickels
Gnome002_2.text: The Towers were here. Soot - sulphur - limestone. Dusted all over. Signature.
Gnome002_2.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Gnome002_3.speaker: Nickels
Gnome002_3.text: I just want to stay here - away from the Towers. Away from the light.

Gnome002_4.speaker: Nickels
Gnome002_4.text: We made it safe. Firm ground - thanks to you. Won't forget it.
Gnome002_4.context: InternalNodeContext: Protected state. Barrier is On, nothing bad happened yet. Not Met.

Gnome002_5.speaker: Nickels
Gnome002_5.text: I hope you get 'em. Ketheric and the like. I know you can.
Gnome002_5.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

Wulbren_19.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_19.text: Hm? Oh - you made it. Well done.

Wulbren_24.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_24.text: Steering a boat is hardly a challenge - and this place is near a beacon in the darkness.
Wulbren_24.context: NodeContext: being a bit of a dickhead here

Wulbren_31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_31.text: As if there was any doubt.

Wulbren_35.speaker: Player
Wulbren_35.text: Yes, despite the fact that you left me behind.

Wulbren_4.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_4.text: It was that or we all die. We clearly didn't - so it was the right choice.

Wulbren_34.speaker: Player
Wulbren_34.text: I should gut you where you stand, traitor!

Wulbren_59.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_59.text: Look, were our positions reversed, I'd be angry too. But if I die, every Ironhand Gnome in the realm will suffer for it.
Wulbren_59.context: NodeContext: trying to calm the player down, in full maniuplation here. Being calm, acting like he had no choice

Wulbren_30.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_30.text: Besides, in the end, we both survived. And that's all that matters. So let's call this a fresh start, for us both.
Wulbren_30.context: NodeContext: reasonable and matter of fact, not allowing room for further argument

Wulbren_39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_39.text: You're good to have humoured Barcus for so long. The poor fellow is like creeping moss, if you know what I mean.
Wulbren_39.context: NodeContext: Wulbren sees Barcus as a fly in his soup and is trying to bond with the player over it.

Wulbren_41.speaker: Player
Wulbren_41.text: I don't. Perhaps you could explain.

Wulbren_65.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_65.text: ...Never mind. Now, is there something you want? I'm a busy man.

Wulbren_20.speaker: Player
Wulbren_20.text: He's got more courage than you give him credit for.

Wulbren_7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_7.text: I'm sure, but that's his business. Now, is there something you want? I'm a busy man.
Wulbren_7.context: NodeContext: Stifling a laugh at the mention of Barcus as 'courageous'

Wulbren_75.speaker: Player
Wulbren_75.text: I'm not here to talk about Barcus - I'm here to talk about you.

Wulbren_9.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_9.text: Is that so? Well, you've piqued my curiosity.

Wulbren_28.speaker: Player
Wulbren_28.text: You're not going to thank me for saving your life?

Wulbren_61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_61.text: Did I not already? How remiss of me.

Wulbren_37.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_37.text: Here - that should cover your services.

Wulbren_38.speaker: Player
Wulbren_38.text: I deserve payment - if not for me, you'd be dead.

Wulbren_95.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_95.text: Surely Barcus will take care of that.

Wulbren_70.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_70.text: You forget - it was I who planned every step of our escape.

Wulbren_89.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_89.text: But even brawn deserves recompense. Here - this should suffice.

Wulbren_76.speaker: Player
Wulbren_76.text: What will you do when you get out of here?

Wulbren_81.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_81.text: I have plans in Baldur's Gate - the work of many years labour that will finally bear fruit.

Wulbren_100.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_100.text: You should look for me once we're in city. The name 'Wulbren Bongle' will be mentioned among many, I've little doubt.

Wulbren_44.speaker: Narrator
Wulbren_44.text: *You recall stories of the Ironhand Gnomes - a talented group of inventors who were banished from Baldur's Gate.*

Wulbren_36.speaker: Player
Wulbren_36.text: You're quite confident in yourself, aren't you?

Wulbren_3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_3.text: If you'd accomplished half of what the Ironhand Gnomes have, you would be too.

Wulbren_60.speaker: Player
Wulbren_60.text: We just have to get to the city first.

Wulbren_72.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_72.text: We will. The Ironhand Gnomes have survived worse.

Wulbren_101.speaker: Player
Wulbren_101.text: Weren't the Ironhand Gnomes exiled from Baldur's Gate?

Wulbren_66.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_66.text: Do not speak of a story you only know the half of.

Wulbren_8.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_8.text: We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.

Wulbren_45.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_45.text: But our forebears were foolish - complicit with Sarevok's madness over a century past, and so we were banished. Still are to this day.

Wulbren_0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_0.text: The very one. It's the only mistake the Ironhand Gnomes ever made - and it cost us everything.

Wulbren_87.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_87.text: I've fought tooth and nail to restore our reputation. Particularly against Gondian detractors who live in glass houses.

Wulbren_79.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_79.text: Our return to Baldur's Gate will usher in a new era for the Ironhand Gnomes. The realm deserves the benefit of our genius.

Wulbren_98.speaker: Player
Wulbren_98.text: Siding with a murderous lunatic is more than 'foolish'.

Wulbren_46.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_46.text: Perhaps. But why should I be punished for a mistake I took no part in? The Gondians refuse us, time and time again.

Wulbren_17.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_17.text: You agree with such machinations? Duly noted.

Wulbren_29.speaker: Player
Wulbren_29.text: Runepowder - I know you were looking for it in the Underdark. What are you planning?

Wulbren_26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_26.text: To use it as all innovators do - for the good of the realm. Nothing to concern yourself with.
Wulbren_26.context: NodeContext: slight smirk here at his own inside joke

Wulbren_49.speaker: Player
Wulbren_49.text: What part do you play in the Ironhand Gnomes?

Wulbren_77.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_77.text: I am more than a 'part'. I am its oil and gears; I am its purpose - its leader.

Wulbren_57.speaker: Player
Wulbren_57.text: How do you and Barcus know each other?

Wulbren_6.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_6.text: Oh, we hail from the same village in the Underdark. Hung about in the same passel of children.

Wulbren_5.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_5.text: Barcus tends to make more of it than it is.

Wulbren_88.speaker: Player
Wulbren_88.text: I'll leave you to your own devices.

Wulbren_56.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_56.text: Every moment Ketheric lives is another I am away from Baldur's Gate - I need to return. And soon.
Wulbren_56.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.NodeContext: authorative

Wulbren_67.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_67.text: Whatever that light is - the Harpers and Flaming Fist can deal with it. We'll follow once it's safe.

Wulbren_80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_80.text: Whatever that light is - the Harpers can deal with it. We'll follow once it's safe.

Wulbren_82.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_82.text: Excuse me. This prick is busy. Why don't you and Barcus go entertain each other elsewhere.
Wulbren_82.context: NodeContext: Player called him a prick earlier, so Wulbren is bristling

Wulbren_23.speaker: Player
Wulbren_23.text: I apologise for losing my temper, but you were being rather harsh.

Wulbren_48.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_48.text: Perhaps, but sometimes cruelty is a kindness. Believe me, Barcus would do well to keep his distance.

Wulbren_69.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_69.text: Now, is there something you want? I'm a busy man.

Wulbren_40.speaker: Player
Wulbren_40.text: Once a prick, always a prick.

Wulbren_71.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_71.context: NodeContext: REsponding to 'once a prick, always a prick.' Very cutting, directed at the player.

Wulbren_83.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_83.text: Hm? Oh - I don't need anything else. Thanks.

Wulbren_10.speaker: Player
Wulbren_10.text: Your friend Barcus is just around the corner - have you said hello?

Wulbren_63.speaker: Player
Wulbren_63.text: That's not a nice way to greet a friend.

Wulbren_27.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_27.text: Friend is a strong word, don't you think?

Wulbren_99.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_99.text: I'm a busy man - state your business.

Wulbren_86.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_86.context: NodeContext: Edgy. Annoyed at being distracted.

Wulbren_84.speaker: Player
Wulbren_84.text: Mind if I ask you a question or two?

Wulbren_93.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_93.text: Ketheric's lackeys found me already - blast it all. You need to deal with him.
Wulbren_93.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.NodeContext: authorative

Wulbren_102.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Wulbren_102.text: The sooner someone deals with Moonrise, the quicker we can leave.

AD_SeekingWulbren_0.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_SeekingWulbren_0.context: NodeContext: He's spotted Wulbren in a crowd, super excited to see him.

AD_SeekingWulbren_1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
AD_SeekingWulbren_1.context: NodeContext: Just heard Wulbren is back; about to go search for him.

Reunion_67.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_67.text: Ah. I'd heard you might be about. How the devil did you get stuck here, Barcus?

Reunion_1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_1.text: I'm not stuck. I came to find you, of course.
Reunion_1.context: NodeContext: Faux chagrin but it's really happy to see Wulbren

Reunion_61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_61.text: Why would you do a foolish thing like that? Really, Barcus.
Reunion_61.context: NodeContext: 'Really' in kind of sarcastic disbelief that Barcus would annoy him like this.

Reunion_30.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_30.text: Unfortunately for me, you're my friend. Rescuing you from mortal peril is my right.

Reunion_34.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_34.text: But you didn't rescue me, did you? I rescued myself, with the aid of this - helper.
Reunion_34.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren waves a hand dismissively, indicating the player on 'helper'NodeContext: 'Helper' applies to the player. Wulbren is being dismissive of the player's ocntributions to his escape.

Reunion_72.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_72.text: Ah - it's you! I should've guessed. Thank you very much for your help finding Wulbren!

Reunion_76.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_76.text: You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the way is clear, pack up and head to Baldur's Gate.

Reunion_31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_31.text: You don't belong here, Barcus. Soon as the Harpers give word that Moonrise has been handled, you ought to get out of here.

Reunion_24.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_24.text: But - Wulbren - the runepowder. We need to discuss what you're going to -
Reunion_24.context: NodeContext: Barcus almost starting to plead here. There's a lot he wants to say to his friend but isn't being given the chance.

Reunion_7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_7.context: NodeContext: Wulbren snaps, losing his temper at Barcus' mention of runepowder.

Reunion_57.speaker: Player
Reunion_57.text: You don't know what Barcus has gone through to find you.

Reunion_14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_14.context: NodeContext: Pleading with the player not to flatter him in front of Wulbren. Barcus' pride and humility.

Reunion_41.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_41.text: Indeed. Neither of you has any clue what's a stake - and why should you? It's Ironhand Gnome business.
Reunion_41.context: NodeContext: Frustration with Barcus and player, biting edge

Reunion_39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_39.text: If you'll excuse me, I have a great deal to do.
Reunion_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.

Reunion_42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_42.context: NodeContext: Cowed but trying to keep his chin up.

Reunion_35.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_35.text: Then it's settled. Good day to you both.
Reunion_35.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.

Reunion_75.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_75.text: Well! There we have it. Wulbren is safe and sound, thanks to you. I owe you a great deal.

Reunion_81.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_81.text: The Brilliant Retort, for starters. Here you are. I hope you'll like it.
Reunion_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back to retrieve Brilliant Retort. Off-camera hand off to player.

Reunion_54.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_54.text: It's a new type of smokepowder. Powerful stuff. Made it myself.

Reunion_43.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_43.text: I give you: The Brilliant Retort!

Reunion_18.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_18.text: Now! I believe our business is well and truly concluded.

Reunion_0.speaker: Player
Reunion_0.text: You risked your life for Wulbren several times over - don't you think he should be a bit more grateful?

Reunion_11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_11.text: There's no need for gratitude between Wulbren and myself. His interests are my interests, and vice versa.

Reunion_20.speaker: Player
Reunion_20.text: You don't owe me, Barcus. If anything, Wulbren does.

Reunion_68.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_68.text: You don't know him, though. This is just his way.

Reunion_21.speaker: Player
Reunion_21.text: You really care about him, don't you.

Reunion_50.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_50.text: Well! Once you're used to someone, you're... used to them.
Reunion_50.context: NodeContext: subtext = he cares about wulbren more than anything in the world but is being barcusy about it

Reunion_26.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_26.text: Nonsense! When you've known each other as long as we have, there aren't sides.

Reunion_55.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_55.text: Wulbren can be a little sharp, but so can I - you should know that better than anyone.
Reunion_55.context: NodeContext: With a touch of humour at the end.

Reunion_73.speaker: Player
Reunion_73.text: Wulbren seems like a real arsehole.

Reunion_6.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_6.text: Don't judge him too harshly. He's been through a lot. When he's had some rest, he'll be back to his usual self.

Reunion_70.speaker: Player
Reunion_70.text: What will you do now, Barcus?

Reunion_23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_23.text: Well! Perhaps Wulbren is right. Perhaps I ought to return to Baldur's Gate.
Reunion_23.context: NodeContext: False chipperness. He was hoping for a welcome reunion with Wulbren, and now he's being sent away after being humiliated.

Reunion_19.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_19.text: I'm glad you agree. Well! I'll just - erm - stand over there. In case Wulbren needs anything.

Reunion_47.speaker: Player
Reunion_47.text: That'll have to wait - it's lethal out there.

Reunion_36.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_36.text: That's all right. I'm a patient fellow. I'm sure you'll clear a path for everyone soon enough.
Reunion_36.context: NodeContext: Talking about waiting for the curse to be cleared, but the subtext is he's patient in general and will continue to be so with Wulbren

Reunion_17.speaker: Player
Reunion_17.text: Why don't you join my camp once we're ready to leave these lands?

Reunion_45.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_45.text: Hm. Perhaps I will. Yes - yes that's a nice idea.

Reunion_69.speaker: Player
Reunion_69.text: I'm heading to the Towers to face Ketheric Thorm. We may not meet again.

Reunion_40.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_40.text: Oh. That's a little sad, isn't it?

Reunion_32.speaker: Player
Reunion_32.text: I'll tell you what: If I make it out alive, why don't you meet me at my camp afterward?

Reunion_5.speaker: Player
Reunion_5.text: With a little luck, I'll still see you at camp later.

Reunion_53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_53.text: I certainly hope so, or Withers will be most despondent. Look after yourself.

Reunion_38.speaker: Player
Reunion_38.text: It is. Farewell, Barcus. And good luck.

Reunion_10.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_10.text: The very same to you. Though with your record, I very much doubt you'll need it.

Reunion_4.speaker: Player
Reunion_4.text: Not really. You're a bit of a wet blanket.

Reunion_58.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_58.text: Handy to have in the event of a fire, though. I'd say 'all the best' but we don't know each other that well, do we? All the most middling. Ta.

Reunion_65.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_65.text: The Brilliant Retort, for starters. Here you are, as promised.
Reunion_65.context: CinematicNodeContext: Reach behind back to retrieve Brilliant Retort. Off-camera hand off to player.

Reunion_29.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_29.context: NodeContext: Quietly furious, almost squaring up to player

Reunion_27.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_27.text: Let's not be uncivilised. Wulbren, perhaps we can talk more later, when you've had a moment to settle in.
Reunion_27.context: NodeContext: Trying to play peacekeeper between the playe and Wulbren.

Reunion_66.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_66.text: Sure. Now: I've business to attend to. Good day to you both.
Reunion_66.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.NodeContext: No interet in catching up with Barcus

Reunion_71.speaker: Player
Reunion_71.text: You can fight this out on your own time. Barcus, I believe you have something for me.

Reunion_52.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_52.text: Of course - but a moment, if you please. Wulbren, I believe we really must discuss -
Reunion_52.context: NodeContext: Flustered; trying to fob off the player momentarily while he gets Wulbren to acknowledge him

Reunion_80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
Reunion_80.text: Enough, Barcus. Pay your friend whatever it is you owe him and leave me out of it.
Reunion_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wulbren turns away, leaves convo.NodeContext: Exasperated, wants to get away from this conversation.

Reunion_25.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Reunion_25.text: There we have it! Wulbren is safe and well, thanks to you. And as you so correctly pointed out, I owe you.
Reunion_25.context: NodeContext: Faking cheerfulness after being rejected by Wulbren

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_1.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_1.text: First things first, we have to make it to the city.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_1.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her friend down, in full big sister/caring mode

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_35.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_35.text: Wulbren can't come with us - it's just you and me now.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_35.context: NodeContext: her leader is dead and she has to hold her own grief in while trying to calm nickels down

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_22.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_22.context: NodeContext: friend is in a panic, trying to gentle persuade them to leave

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_26.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_26.text: Outside the air is heavy - dangerous. We can't.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_3.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_3.text: There must be another way to the city.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_43.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_43.text: We've been gone too long as it is. Now is not the time to dilly-dally.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_19.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_19.text: The plan will go ahead, sir. We'll make sure of it.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_19.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her boss, to see the bright side

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_4.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_4.text: Fine. We'll rest here for a while.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_25.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_25.text: Then we leave for Baldur's Gate.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_18.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_18.text: Not by foot. The air is heavy - deadly. Too much. Too dangerous.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_18.context: NodeContext: worried, a little far off and distant, a touch of fear

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_7.text: Damn it all - I thought we'd be closer to the city.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_7.context: NodeContext: frustrated, touch of anger - his plan isn't going to, well, plan

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_24.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_24.text: Reinforced walls, secured entrance. Here is good - safe.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_24.context: NodeContext: looking around, measuring and assessing - sounding a little far off

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_11.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_11.text: I agree, sir. This gives us time to regroup.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_11.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her boss, to see the bright side

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_8.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_8.text: We should place a grave marker for Nickels - somewhere warm and cosy.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_8.context: NodeContext: trying to be professional but inside she's really upset - nickles was like a brother to her

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_5.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_5.text: Securing passage to the city comes first.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_5.context: NodeContext: aware his friend is grieving but doesn't have time for it - all business like

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_10.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_10.text: The city is far. The air is heavy - dangerous. Too much.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_0.text: Have you forgotten what's at stake here?
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_0.context: NodeContext: getting irritated, wants to be obeyed without question or argument

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_20.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_20.text: We make it to the city or we die - it's that simple.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_20.context: NodeContext: getting irritated, wants to be obeyed without question or argument

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_16.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_16.text: Curses - why did we land so far from Baldur's Gate?

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_6.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_6.context: NodeContext: trying to reign back in his irritation

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_17.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_17.text: What of the others? In the Underdark?

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_42.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_42.text: If they're alive, they'll meet us in the city.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_27.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_27.text: Have you forgotten what's at stake? You're Ironhand Gnomes - act like it.

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_40.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_40.text: We're with you to the end, sir, but we're exhausted.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_40.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her boss, to see the bright side

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_12.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_12.text: No sleep makes mistakes. Mistakes means death.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_12.context: NodeContext:  sounding a little far off

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_28.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_28.context: NodeContext: trying not to be annoyed but failing

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_44.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_44.context: NodeContext: dsitressed and upset, brink of tears

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_13.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_13.text: I need you to focus, all right? The plan cannot fail.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_13.context: NodeContext: this is his pathetic attempt at being 'caring' all he's thinking is 'why did i get stuck with this one'

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_29.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_29.text: Did Nickels have any family in the city?
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_29.context: NodeContext: trying to distract herself from her own grief

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_41.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_41.text: I appreciate you and Nickels were close, but I need you to focus.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_41.context: NodeContext: all business - the slightest touch of irritation

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_14.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_14.context: NodeContext: snaps to attention - she'd do anything for wulbren

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_31.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_31.context: NodeContext: panicked, his leader is dead and he's distressed

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_9.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_9.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her friend down, in full big sister/caring mode

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_36.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_36.text: But Wulbren isn't here! What do we do?
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_36.context: NodeContext: still panicking but a little calmer with nimble around

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_32.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_32.text: Let's take a break - catch up on some sleep.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_32.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her friend down, in full big sister/caring mode

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_39.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_39.text: We'll figure this out - one step at a time.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_39.context: NodeContext: trying to calm her friend down, in full big sister/caring mode

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_37.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_37.text: Nimble was an excellent Ironhand Gnome - she'll be difficult to replace.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_37.context: NodeContext: his 'friend' is dead but all he's thinking about is the loss of a soldier

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_34.speaker: Nickels
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_34.context: NodeContext: crying - his best friend is dead

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_38.speaker: Nimble
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_38.context: NodeContext: grief shoved to one side, all business now

AD_ReturnedPrisoners_33.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_33.text: Get to the city. The plan proceeds from there.
AD_ReturnedPrisoners_33.context: NodeContext: trying to think three steps ahead, full focus on his goals

UnfortunateGnome_3.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_3.text: There's something in the air. I don't like it.
UnfortunateGnome_3.context: NodeContext: Respnding to 'Perhaps what you're sensing is the shadowcurse'. Really, what Barcus is sensing is that Wulbren is dead.

UnfortunateGnome_152.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_152.text: Could be the evil curse surrounding us.

UnfortunateGnome_94.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_94.text: I don't know. I can't help but feel that something's... especially wrong. I mustn't let my imagination run away with me, though.

UnfortunateGnome_17.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_17.context: NodeContext: Normal affect, Barcus' version of a decent mood

UnfortunateGnome_26.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_26.text: Where in the world did everyone go? Quite the fuss, but I'm not sure why. You'll - you'll follow up, keep things in hand, won't you? Of course you will.

UnfortunateGnome_31.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_31.text: Go on, then. No one but hang-abouts and n'er-do-muches here. And myself, of course.

UnfortunateGnome_74.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_74.text: No. And pestering the craftsman won't speed things up!

UnfortunateGnome_103.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_103.context: NodeContext: in response to "I'd like to trade"

UnfortunateGnome_186.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_186.text: Now, if you're done rifling through my things...

UnfortunateGnome_54.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_54.text: I say, are you quite all right? You look a little peaky.

UnfortunateGnome_96.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_96.text: I went to Moonrise Towers. All the captives there have perished.

UnfortunateGnome_136.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_136.text: Perished... but that means... but Wulbren. How could it be...?

UnfortunateGnome_206.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_206.text: I'm sorry, Barcus - Wulbren is dead.

UnfortunateGnome_6.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Player has just told Barcus that Wulbren is dead, and Barcus is trying to make sense of it. He's about to faint.

UnfortunateGnome_27.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_27.text: I don't know what you mean.

UnfortunateGnome_88.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_88.context: NodeContext: REplying to player who is denying that anything's the matter.

UnfortunateGnome_69.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_69.context: NodeContext: After he fainted, Barcus wakes up and is a bit unsteady. He remembers Wulbren is dead and is trying to process. A bit dissociated

UnfortunateGnome_149.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_149.text: Wulbren's gone. Wulbren's... dead. But. You know that.
UnfortunateGnome_149.context: NodeContext: Trying to put all the facts together, through the shock of losing Wulbren

UnfortunateGnome_150.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_150.text: How can it be? I failed him so utterly.

UnfortunateGnome_93.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_93.text: Wulbren got himself into this mess. It isn't your fault.

UnfortunateGnome_208.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_208.text: He should never have joined those bloody Ironhand Gnomes. I told him, and I told him, and I told him. And now? Now he's dead.

UnfortunateGnome_75.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_75.text: There's nothing I can do. It's over.

UnfortunateGnome_166.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_166.text: That bloody cult has taken too much. They need to be stopped.

UnfortunateGnome_18.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_18.text: The Brilliant Retort is ready. It's yours.

UnfortunateGnome_91.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_91.text: Take it. And give the Absolute hell.
UnfortunateGnome_91.context: NodeContext: With a cold edge; anger at hte death of Wulbren sinking in. Disgust on 'the Absolute'

UnfortunateGnome_67.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_67.text: While you were infiltrating the Towers, I was working on something I thought might help in the fight against those cultists.

UnfortunateGnome_141.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_141.text: It's new type of smokepowder. Plenty of firepower in it, but with an extra surprise. Sure to take those cultists down a short road, if you catch my meaning.

UnfortunateGnome_66.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_66.text: I call it the Brilliant Retort. Seems a bit glib now - but it would've made Wulbren smile, I think.

UnfortunateGnome_25.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_25.text: It's up to you. You're the only one capable of it. Crush them.

UnfortunateGnome_42.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_42.text: I'll... well. I'll... I'm not sure.
UnfortunateGnome_42.context: NodeContext: Response to 'what will you do now that Wulbren's dead'. He cant fathom an answer

UnfortunateGnome_180.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_180.text: It's too late for Wulbren. For me. But not for others. Nor for you.

UnfortunateGnome_123.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_123.text: A terrible thing, isn't it? A terrible thing, to try your best and get nowhere at all.

UnfortunateGnome_43.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_43.text: Or worse - to try your best and end up hurting the one you love the most.

UnfortunateGnome_114.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_114.text: What a brutal horror this life can be.

UnfortunateGnome_85.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_85.text: Ah - you found your way. Good.
UnfortunateGnome_85.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player approaches, Barcus is still facing his work bench, inspecting beakers of powder in the light. With his back turned to player, without looking up, he addresses the player..

UnfortunateGnome_153.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_153.context: NodeContext: answering 'you were supposed to wait at camp.'

UnfortunateGnome_71.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_71.text: I thought I'd scout ahead. Check for any nasty surprises. Of which I found a great deal.
UnfortunateGnome_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face playerNodeContext: Grave but wry; Barcus turns to face the player

UnfortunateGnome_199.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_199.text: Shades. Death. Harpers. Flaming Fist. And this, of course. And the makings of an alchemist's workbench. Ingredients, too.
UnfortunateGnome_199.context: NodeContext: Grim, but at the mention of the workbench he can't help but light up a little. He's an inventor at heart and is very enthused.

UnfortunateGnome_8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_8.text: There's a recipe I'm trying to replicate. Something that might help you.
UnfortunateGnome_8.context: NodeContext: He's a bit shy about being vulnerable by being friendly to you, but trying to play it cool

UnfortunateGnome_15.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_15.text: That is - if you're still going to help Wulbren and the others.

UnfortunateGnome_159.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_159.text: In that case, you'll be very pleased to learn what I have in store for you.

UnfortunateGnome_176.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_176.text: Depends. What did you say you were making?

UnfortunateGnome_204.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_204.text: I help a lot of people - remind me who you mean?

UnfortunateGnome_171.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_171.text: The deep gnomes at the Towers, of course! And Wulbren among them, if he's to be found.

UnfortunateGnome_61.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_61.text: Aren't you some kind of wandering hero? Isn't this what you do?

UnfortunateGnome_105.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_105.text: I suppose I've earned the reputation. I'll help find your friends.

UnfortunateGnome_106.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_106.text: If anyone can, I'm certain it's you. But you won't do it alone. I'm working on a recipe to help you on your way.

UnfortunateGnome_14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_14.text: A new type of smokepowder. All the bang and boom of the original, but with an extra surprise. I call it the Brilliant Retort.

UnfortunateGnome_216.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_216.text: You'll need it if you're going to survive this cursed place.

UnfortunateGnome_209.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_209.text: You'll need it if you're going to get into Moonrise Towers and help the deep gnomes taken prisoner there.

UnfortunateGnome_19.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_19.text: You'll need it if you're going to save Wulbren.
UnfortunateGnome_19.context: NodeContext: A quiet, intimate plea encased with his stoicism.

UnfortunateGnome_100.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_100.text: I thought that was your mission.

UnfortunateGnome_211.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_211.text: Let's call a thing a thing: a deep gnome won't get far into the Absolute's orgy of evil. We already learned that in the Underdark with those sadistic duergar, didn't we? It's doubly true in this place.

UnfortunateGnome_112.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_112.text: You, on the other hand, have proven resourceful in such infiltrations.

UnfortunateGnome_226.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_226.text: How did deep gnomes get trapped in the Towers?

UnfortunateGnome_102.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_102.text: They didn't get trapped, they were kidnapped! Taken against their will by those cultists. If I ever get my hands on one of them... well. With you on the job, perhaps I won't have to find out.

UnfortunateGnome_160.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_160.text: I'll do my part according to my talents, and you, I hope, will do yours.

UnfortunateGnome_213.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_213.text: The Brilliant Retort will aid you. Thus, I will make it.

UnfortunateGnome_135.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_135.text: Anything I can do to help?

UnfortunateGnome_230.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_230.text: Unless you've got access to a 300-year-old Tempusian apothecarial almanac, no.

UnfortunateGnome_20.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_20.text: But - that's for me to worry about.

UnfortunateGnome_131.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_131.text: You - you do whatever it is you do.

UnfortunateGnome_151.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_151.text: Some of us are counting on you.

UnfortunateGnome_164.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_164.text: I'll keep an eye out for your friends, but no promises.

UnfortunateGnome_161.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_161.text: I seek not promises, my friend, but deeds worthy of your prodigious talents.
UnfortunateGnome_161.context: NodeContext: He's haphazardly using flattery; he's not used to resorting to it.

UnfortunateGnome_228.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_228.text: Now! You - off to your... heroism, as it were.

UnfortunateGnome_77.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_77.text: I like the name. What's it do?

UnfortunateGnome_119.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_119.text: Let's not ruin the surprise, hmm?

UnfortunateGnome_178.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_178.text: Sounds good. But I haven't forgotten you also promised me a reward once I've saved your friend.

UnfortunateGnome_36.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_36.text: Nor have I. Everything in its due course, hmm? First, the Brilliant Retort. Then, Wulbren. Then, your reward.

UnfortunateGnome_167.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_167.text: I have more important things to do.

UnfortunateGnome_225.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_225.text: Whatever it is, I'm sure the rescue of a few innocent citizens will round it out nicely.

UnfortunateGnome_219.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_219.text: A friend. I'd do anything to find him. Including trusting his fate to the likes of you.
UnfortunateGnome_219.context: NodeContext: He softens. His 'insult' to the player isn't serious. He knows you're his best bet and he says this wryly, not meant to insult.

UnfortunateGnome_59.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_59.text: An old friend. The kind one doesn't simply leave to his own reckless fate - even when it leads to the heart of a murderous cult.
UnfortunateGnome_59.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

UnfortunateGnome_175.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_175.text: I did - though with a few hiccups along the way.

UnfortunateGnome_12.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_12.text: Nasty place, isn't it. My torch only just held out long enough for me to find my way here.
UnfortunateGnome_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player NodeContext: He turns to face the player

UnfortunateGnome_133.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_133.text: I told you I'd help rescue Wulbren and the others - this is my first stop.

UnfortunateGnome_46.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_46.text: I haven't forgotten. And as it happens, I was making something to help you on your way.
UnfortunateGnome_46.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player
 NodeContext: He's quite excited by what you've said, but trying to play it down in classic Barcus fashion. He turns around on 'And as it happens, I was making something to help you on your way.'

UnfortunateGnome_220.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_220.text: Hadn't expected to find this place. I'm trying to get into the Towers.

UnfortunateGnome_47.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_47.text: If anyone can, I'm sure it's you.
UnfortunateGnome_47.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Barcus turns to face player
 NodeContext: He turns to face the player here. He's sincere, but deadpan in his delivery. He's not one to betray emotion, but he does speak facts unbegrudgingly.

UnfortunateGnome_58.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_58.text: What are you doing here, anyway?

UnfortunateGnome_203.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_203.text: I decided to scout ahead and get the lay of the land.

UnfortunateGnome_177.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_177.text: It didn't seem right to let you do all the work. And as it happens, I've cobbled together something of an alchemist's workbench here in this inn.

UnfortunateGnome_95.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_95.text: Your work here isn't done. So perhaps you should get on with it.

UnfortunateGnome_120.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_120.context: NodeContext: He's terrified and heartbroken but trying to hold it together.

UnfortunateGnome_65.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_65.text: I'm afraid he didn't make it.

UnfortunateGnome_128.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_128.text: That's what the others said. And yet... and yet... how could it be?
UnfortunateGnome_128.context: NodeContext: Reeling, having just heard Wulbren is dead. He's having trouble wrappng his head around this. Decimated.

UnfortunateGnome_130.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Woozy, losing consciousness, full line would be 'How could it be that Wulbren is dead?'

UnfortunateGnome_154.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_154.text: Talk to your friends about it. It's none of my business.

UnfortunateGnome_11.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: Losing consciousness, about to faint

UnfortunateGnome_217.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_217.text: The cult has probably taken him for parts by now. Oh well.

UnfortunateGnome_146.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Barcus faints at the end of the nodeNodeContext: GEtting ready to faint, then faints

UnfortunateGnome_125.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_125.context: NodeContext: Sad, post poor outcome for Wulbren

UnfortunateGnome_4.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_4.text: Fortunately for me, you do. There was a rather compromising incident at a windmill, and another with some duergar.

UnfortunateGnome_165.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_165.text: I can't tell if you're my good luck charm, or an omen of my every misfortunate.

UnfortunateGnome_41.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_41.text: Ah, of course. How are things, Barcus?

UnfortunateGnome_118.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_118.text: How are things? How are things?

UnfortunateGnome_138.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_138.text: I'll soon be off to Moonrise Towers to look for my friend Wulbren. I understand you might be headed in that direction as well.

UnfortunateGnome_144.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_144.text: I have reason to believe the seat of the Absolute is in Moonrise.

UnfortunateGnome_83.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_83.text: I'm sure I'll have no problem locating Wulbren and skipping out of there hand in hand!

UnfortunateGnome_63.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_63.text: You understand correctly. But it would be suicide for you to go near the place.

UnfortunateGnome_72.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_72.text: Don't threaten me with a good time. My search for Wulbren has been one quagmire after another, as you know.

UnfortunateGnome_163.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_163.text: Still. A friend is a friend. And Wulbren won't last long in a place as dreadful as the Towers.

UnfortunateGnome_53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_53.text: An old friend. The kind one doesn't simply leave to his own reckless fate - even when it leads to the heart of a murderous cult!
UnfortunateGnome_53.context: NodeContext: With a twinge of irony. Barcus realizes he's being a bit excessive in pursuing Wulbren this far, but there's no 2 ways about it. He'd do anything to save his dumbass friend.

UnfortunateGnome_57.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_57.text: If he's there, I plan to find him.

UnfortunateGnome_70.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_70.text: Even if you get past the shadow curse, you'll never make it past that many cultists.

UnfortunateGnome_56.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_56.text: I'm sure I'll come up with... something.
UnfortunateGnome_56.context: NodeContext: Losing confidence in his own abilities.

UnfortunateGnome_183.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_183.text: I'm going to Moonrise Towers, too. Why don't you let me look for him.

UnfortunateGnome_168.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_168.text: You wouldn't even know what he looks like.

UnfortunateGnome_155.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_155.text: Then again, my track record is... well. Discouraging.
UnfortunateGnome_155.context: NodeContext: Coming around, realizing he might not be best-suited to find Wulbren.

UnfortunateGnome_64.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_64.text: Then it's settled. You stay here. I'll search the Towers.

UnfortunateGnome_89.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_89.text: That's very decent of you. Very decent of you indeed.
UnfortunateGnome_89.context: NodeContext: Quite grateful but not used to showing it.

UnfortunateGnome_32.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_32.text: But! I won't stand idle. I've spotted an alchemist's scales and had already been cooking up a little something that might help against those cultists.
UnfortunateGnome_32.context: NodeContext: Wants to be useful, getting back to his old perfunctory self.

UnfortunateGnome_23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_23.text: I'll get to work on the Brilliant Retort. You get to work at the Towers. Deal?

UnfortunateGnome_48.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_48.text: A new type of smokepowder. All the bang and boom of the original, but with an extra surprise. Guaranteed to end any and all arguments or protestations.

UnfortunateGnome_39.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_39.text: Very good, very good. Very good indeed!

UnfortunateGnome_80.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_80.text: Give me the schematics for the Brilliant Retort and we have a deal.

UnfortunateGnome_229.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_229.text: Don't be ridiculous - if I give you the schematics, how in all of Toril am I supposed to make the damn thing?

UnfortunateGnome_212.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_212.text: I don't work for free. Throw in the plans for what you're working on and I'll consider.

UnfortunateGnome_181.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_181.text: Please. I'll make it extra explosive. Just for you.

UnfortunateGnome_223.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_223.text: Disappointment. The raisin cookie of the soul.

UnfortunateGnome_0.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_0.text: Very well! I wish you a safe journey. Perhaps I'll see you on the road to the Towers.

UnfortunateGnome_143.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_143.text: But with a little luck, perhaps I won't.

UnfortunateGnome_201.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_201.text: Seems you can handle things yourself.

UnfortunateGnome_117.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_117.text: I'll leave you to consider it.

UnfortunateGnome_210.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_210.text: Wait! Wait. I may be proud, but I'm no fool. If Wulbren is to be found, you stand the best chance of finding him.

UnfortunateGnome_218.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_218.text: If you'll agree to look for him, I'll make myself useful here. I've spotted an alchemist's scales and had already been dreaming up a little something to help fight off those loathsome cultists.

UnfortunateGnome_9.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_9.text: Do as you wish, but I won't rescue you a third time.

UnfortunateGnome_190.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_190.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic. In response to the player being snarky.

UnfortunateGnome_29.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_29.text: Then again... if you're going to the Towers... it stands to reason you might encounter Wulbren while you're there.

UnfortunateGnome_45.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_45.text: Perhaps we ought to allocate our resources intelligently. According to our talents, as it were.

UnfortunateGnome_2.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_2.text: Wulbren needs a hero. Someone like you. And you need a way to protect yourself against the forces of evil, hm?

UnfortunateGnome_214.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_214.text: How did you make your way through the shadows?

UnfortunateGnome_92.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_92.text: It helps to know when to close your eyes and run. I bumped into this inn before any nasty shadows got their tendrils on me.

UnfortunateGnome_224.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_224.text: Now, I've only to find my way into the Towers...

UnfortunateGnome_107.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_107.text: Seems you've found yourself in another scrape.

UnfortunateGnome_184.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_184.text: Out of one, really. It took a bit of nimble footwork to make it through the darkness un-cursed.

UnfortunateGnome_192.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_192.text: Luckily, I found this place. As have you.

UnfortunateGnome_16.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_16.text: Indeed. I found this place on my way to Moonrise Towers.

UnfortunateGnome_116.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_116.text: There are deep gnomes being held in Moonrise Towers. One of them is my friend Wulbren.

UnfortunateGnome_86.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_86.text: I hope you got a warmer welcome than I.

UnfortunateGnome_62.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_62.text: That seems likely. Everyone loves providing refuge for a poor, defenceless deep gnome.
UnfortunateGnome_62.context: NodeContext: Putting on a bit of an act, miming helplessness that masks his cynicism

UnfortunateGnome_30.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_30.text: I was about to ask you the same. I'm going to Moonrise Towers in search of my friend Wulbren.

UnfortunateGnome_195.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_195.text: And you're doing... general heroism, I believe it is?

UnfortunateGnome_122.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_122.text: What happened to the other gnomes you were with?

UnfortunateGnome_126.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_126.text: Everyone seems to be quite a-flutter. Do you know why?

UnfortunateGnome_21.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_21.text: Are you joking? Barcus, Wulbren is right in the other room.

UnfortunateGnome_137.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_137.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Disbelief, then excitement as he realizes Wulbren is in the other room

UnfortunateGnome_78.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_78.text: Haven't you heard? I freed the people being held in Moonrise Towers.

UnfortunateGnome_111.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_111.text: You - you did? But that means... Wulbren!
UnfortunateGnome_111.context: CinematicNodeContext: He runs off from the player to go find Wulbren, who's in the other room.NodeContext: Surprised and excited

UnfortunateGnome_73.speaker: Player
UnfortunateGnome_73.text: I did what you asked. Ready for my reward.

UnfortunateGnome_188.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_188.text: You mean - but that means - Wulbren.

UnfortunateGnome_76.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_76.context: NodeContext: Urgently wants to go find Wulbren, who's been found; happy.

UnfortunateGnome_50.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_50.text: A new type of smokepowder. I call it the Brilliant Retort. It's yours! Now - I need to go find Wulbren!

UnfortunateGnome_202.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_202.text: I give you: The Brilliant Retort! Now - I need to go find Wulbren!

UnfortunateGnome_28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_28.text: Huh? It... seems to have disappeared.

UnfortunateGnome_148.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_148.text: Dear me. That's quite a loss. But! Oh well! Wulbren's back!

UnfortunateGnome_222.speaker: Barcus Wroot
UnfortunateGnome_222.text: A-ha. I was hoping you'd find this place. Thought you might've fallen in a hole. I'm pleased to see you, but I think there's something happening at the Towers. You like heroism, don't you? Might be of interest.
